oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NATIONAL NONTIDAL SEA LEVEL FORECASTS ON A COASTAL WAVEGUIDE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Taylor, Andy
Greenslade, Diana
Zhou, Xiaobing
Brassington, Gary
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An approach to reduce gridded forecast data to novel waveguide coordinates is demonstrated; informed by the literature on coastally trapped waves. This does not produce new forecasts per se, but reduces data to a useful model-independent physically ordered array. Discussion is limited to the Australian mainland and forecast systems currently maintained in national operations. Heterogenous forecast models are considered with regard to the development of "seamless" sea level services across timescales.Recorded Presentation from the vICCE (YouTube Link): https://youtu.be/jlJO_dxHwuw
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36v (2020): Proceedings of virtual Conference on Coastal Engineering, 2020; currents.26
